item.title: Adventurers of the Uncharted
item.description: It’s free RPG day but unfortunately I still do not have anything commercial to give away. But in the spirit of things here is this bastardization of SotU that I have been working on and off on: Adventurers of the Uncharted v1 (PDF) Adventurers of the Uncharted v1 (ODT) I had planned to expand out the species, classes, feats, spells, etc. But with working on Dreamhaven and other projects I haven’t put much time in it.

item.title: Bound for Glory
item.description: Sarah, Chris, and I decided to take a very short break from working on Dreamhaven Issue 1 to create a submission to the 2020 One Page Dungeon Contest. In this heavenly train heist, you and your teen angel pals attempt to kidnap the mascot of your demonic counterparts from Infernal College. So here it is: PDF Version We had a blast doing it and I think if we have time we will enter again next year.

item.title: Plumbing the Depths with Maze Rats
item.description: Well we have a wacky one here kids! The group got together in between our normal campaign sessions to play a one-off and we finally got to check out a system I’ve been dying try for a while now. That system would of course be Maze Rats by Ben Milton. I wanted to pair this ultra-light system with a quick adventure so I opted again for a One Page Dungeon since the last one went so well.

item.title: Searchers of the Unknown Omnibus v4
item.description: Searchers of the Unknown Omnibus v4 (PDF) Searchers of the Unknown Omnibus v4 (ODT) This is a minor update to my Searchers of the Unknown Omnibus. Changes include: Removed Encounter Movement Penalty for shields Nerfed bonuses for Races and Classes as I think they were excessive Added bonus for stealth and stunts for thieves Various minor fixes and tweaks Version 3 of the Omnibus can still be found here

item.title: The Lightless Beacon Recap
item.description: Introduction A few months ago my regular D&D 5E group decided we wanted to play a one shot of Call of Cthulhu for Halloween. Many of our players were also in a book club together in which we are doing several Lovecraft stories for Halloween so we thought the coinciding game would be a fun crossover. As the Dungeon Master of the group it fell to me to take on the mantle of the Keeper of Arcane Lore…

item.title: Searchers of the Unknown Omnibus v3
item.description: "catacomb"by begemot_dn is licensed under CC BY-NC 2.0 Update: Version 4 is available here Searchers of the Unknown Omnibus v3 (PDF) Searchers of the Unknown Omnibus v3 (ODT) Last week I posted about my play test of the Searchers of the Unknown Omnibus using Temple of the Moon Priests. That session was enlightening and caused me to spend a lot of time thinking about SotU and the lessons I had learned.

item.title: Temple of the Moon Priests with Searchers of the Unknown
item.description: Note: Unless otherwise noted the images in this post are from Temple of the Moon Priests by Will Doyle and Stacey Allan under Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 (CC BY-SA 3.0 US) Last week I shared my edit of Searchers of the Unknown which I call the Searchers of the Unkown Omnibus. At the time I talked about my desire to play test the minimalist system. It seems fate saw it as a priority as well.

item.title: Searchers of the Unknown Omnibus
item.description: Update: Version 4 is available here Searchers of the Unknown Omnibus (PDF) Searchers of the Unknown Omnibus (ODT) A friend of mine had been asking me for a few years now if we could play D&D. She has never played before and it got me thinking about the quickest and easiest way to introduce new players to tabletop roleplaying games. I looked at HERE’S SOME FUCKIN’ D&D by Dustin R.
